job_titles: Senior Economic Consultant Scenarios and Asset Valuation
job_description:
Would you like to join a dynamic company that provides advisory services to a diverse, international client base comprised of pension funds, insurance companies, sovereign wealth funds, banks, and asset managers? Are you passionate about simplifying and solving complex problems, while delivering exceptional client service? Are you interested in building your consulting expertise in the exciting fields of economic scenarios and asset valuation? Do you stay up-to-date with global economic developments and financial news? If you answered yes to these questions, we invite you to consider joining us as our Senior Economic Consultant for Scenarios and Asset Valuation.
What do we have to offer?
As a senior economic consultant, our clients see you as their trusted advisor on our scenario-based risk and return expectations and their positioning against the current macroeconomic environment. The quantitative economic scenarios that you will be advising on are a crucial input in the financial decision making for many applications such as ALM, risk management, and financial planning. Example applications include analyzing exposure to which asset classes fits best with investment goals, and whether investment goals are attainable with the current strategic asset allocation.

As a project leader, you are responsible for the management of sales and client servicing projects. Examples are running trials of our scenarios for potential new clients, the onboarding and implementation of new clients, and projects that improve the services that we provide to our global client base, such as rolling out a new stress testing suite. In doing so, you have the opportunity develop yourself technically, economically, and financially, since our quantitative scenarios cover every asset class that typically is part of the portfolios of our global client base.
In your role, you coach other consultants and build relationships with key clients to work on a long-term partnership. This involves personal responsibility for one or more client accounts. You ensure that our clients are satisfied with the products and services that we provide. To do so, you will work closely with other consultants and our quantitative analysts to help our clients understand and use our quantitative economic scenarios as well as the software that our clients use to work with these.

We offer you plenty of room and autonomy to fully apply your talents and highly value an enterprising spirit. You will be given responsibilities immediately and you will be personally and actively mentored in the process.

The Scenarios and Asset Valuation Solution
You will be part of our Scenarios and Asset Valuation (SAV) Solution, which is a group of about 25 persons with an academic background. SAV is an innovative multidisciplinary group with Consultants, Quantitative Financial Analysts, and Quantitative Developers as well as Software Developers.

We provide both real-world and risk-neutral economic scenarios to enable our clients to manage the complexity of investment decision making. Our real-world scenarios provide risk and return projections that dynamically adjust to the latest economic and financial market circumstances. This includes the effects of ‘externalities’ such as central bank interventions or the Covid-19 pandemic and has a global coverage of asset classes for many different regions. We achieve this by integrating characteristics of realistic market behavior (“stylized facts”) into forward-looking asset prices, yield curves, and volatilities as well as into the broader macro-economic environment. Our risk-neutral scenarios enable actuaries and finance professionals to perform market-consistent valuations of optionality in insurance liabilities and of financial contingent claims more generally.
For a flavor of what we do, please refer to our introduction video, quarterly webinars or Insights.
What’s in it for you?
We offer you a challenging and rewarding role in a growing company, while being part of an inspirational global business with a lot of opportunities for personal and professional career development.

The salary range is € 77.000 - € 120.000 on a yearly basis (including variable pay, 13th month, holiday allowance), dependent on your role, competencies, and experience.

In addition to a competitive salary, we offer you excellent benefits, including:
An open and informal work environment (Active staff association, annual ski trip, staff social events, annual summer and Christmas party and much more) with inspiring, smart and enthusiastic colleagues
Opportunities to develop yourself with a training program as well as weekly research and knowledge-sharing meetings
Hybrid working (working from the office in Rotterdam or Amsterdam with possibility to partly work from your home office)
The prospect of a permanent contract, because we strive for a long-term collaboration
Participation in the pension scheme, commute and business travel allowance, working from home allowance, 27 vacation days and the possibility to buy more.
Who are you?
Do you enjoy keeping up-to-date with global economic trends and financial news? Are you energized by engaging with customers and building lasting relationships? Your exceptional social and communication skills enable you to articulate complex matters with ease to clients and senior stakeholders. If this sounds like you, we want you to join our team as Senior Economic Consultant Scenarios and Asset Valuation.

In addition, the following aspects are important:

A clear affinity with finance is mandatory, as is an MSc qualification, preferably in Econometrics, (Quantitative) Finance, or Economics
Solid command of the English language, both in speaking and in writing
5-7 years of relevant work experience
You’re a European citizen or a European permanent resident.
Who are we?
Working at Ortec Finance means working somewhere else. It means working in a world where colleagues meet, gather knowledge and where likeminded peers are always willing to help each other. Where the organizational culture is friendly, flat, and non-political.

Working at Ortec Finance also means working in a continuously innovating world where science, academics and mathematics dominate, since models are key in helping Ortec Finance’ clients with complex financial decisions. Because that’s what we love: giving our clients the best advice possible. Where the daily job is very in-dept, based on evidence and relevant for society. It means a job that matters. Where the learning curve is steep; we learn something new every single day. And we need to, because continuously innovation is key. Especially in a fin tech world. We don’t necessarily follow all conventions. Because yes, we are a bit rebellious too.
Ortec Finance is the leading provider of technology and solutions for risk and return management. It is our purpose to enable people to manage the complexity of investment decisions. We do this through delivering leading technologies and solutions for investment decision-making to financial institutions around the world. Our strength lies in an effective combination of advanced models, innovative technology and in-depth market knowledge.

Headquartered in Rotterdam, Ortec Finance has offices in Amsterdam, London, Toronto, Melbourne, and Zurich.

20+ countries represented;
500+ customers;
96% retention rate;
3 trillion euros total assets managed by our clients.
More at www.ortecfinance.com

More information or to apply?
For more information regarding this position please contact our HR department at +31 10 700 5000. To apply, please use the application button to send us your CV and cover letter.
You must be a European citizen or European permanent resident to be considered for this opportunity.

We hope to meet you soon!

You and your job

Rabobank is the bank of today and tomorrow. We are transforming our processes in solutions to our customers; safe, fast, easy. Digital transformation is part of our daily life. Next to all advantages we face new challenges in IT. As risk department we are actively involved to guide our organization around these challenges and avoid digital risks. We are also involved to meet the needs and wants of our customers and stakeholders.
As an IT Risk Partner, you make an important contribution to the (first line) monitoring of business risks, including Business Continuity Management, Information Security, IT Risk and Identity Access Management. You increase awareness of risks and support the organization by offering all information that the organization needs in the field of risk management. You provide first-line monitoring at tactical and operational level to be in control. We work according a structured and standardized process. Our way of working and especially our expertise helps the Tech & Non-Tech domains to master risk management in their daily practice.
As a team we are successful if awareness and maturity of our business partners has grown to a compliance level that surpasses legislation and prevents any risk we face in IT. Your role is to advice, stimulate, guard and coach different stakeholders within the IT organisation. As a risk partner in risk management you know how to translate risk guidelines and processes and guide the first line into applying these guidelines

Responsibilities

In your role as IT Risk Partner you focus on preparing and taking care of the Risk & Control processes for themes such as privacy, data management, fraud, and technology. You do this by, among other things:
Create awareness and stimulate ownership in our IT tech domains
Execution of the annual control cycle including validation of performed controls and follow up of the proposed actions
Enter into a dialog, challenge and collaborate with stakeholders, such as Risk managers, process owners
Continuous improvement of yourself and the team, by making proposals, creating awareness and implementing them
Challenge control and process owners
Contribute to the continuous improvement of quality and policy
Together we achieve more

Our RCC team brings talents together so we can challenge and support our organisation of their risks and controls, this in line with our mission "Driving Secure Banking Together". As a Risk Partner you are part of a diverse team with different roles, skills and talents/expertise that complement each other. Together we share experiences and learn from each other every day. This is supported by the culture and environment we create within the team.
‘As a risk partner you are securing banking for your customers.
That’s where you are making an impact’.

Ibrahim Nijad, IT Risk Partner
Working at Rabobank IT - Risk Manager - YouTube
You and your talent

Customer focus, collaboration, result orientation, focus and persuasiveness are essential for the success of a Risk Partner. Do you recognize yourself in these qualities?
You are analytically strong and focus on improvements
You have a focus on delivering quality
You are result-oriented
You like to work in a team
You have excellent communication skills
You have mastered the Dutch (preferred) and English (required) language in word and writing
You have a good sense of humour
3 years of experience in Risk Management and IT
Basic knowledge of Business Continuity Management, Information Security, IT Risk, Identity Access Management, Compliance and Privacy
About the department
CSI is the driving force behind demonstrating control over business risks to ensure safety. The department is responsible for the First Line of Risk and Monitoring of the entire CITO domain, including assessing and implementing applicable laws and regulations, as proposed by the domain CLR (Compliance, Legal & Risk), and translating them into clear and enforceable Standards, Controls and Procedures. It is the ambition of the department to be a partner with an integrated approach, knowledge and expertise. In doing so, we act as a sparring partner for Rabobank Business and external partners in the field of Risk & Security.

This is what we offer you
a gross monthly salary between €3.959 and €6.741 (scale 9 or 10)
an extra budget of 11% of your gross monthly salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
a combination of working from home and at the office
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a IT Risk Partner based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
You and the job application process
Any questions about the job content? Contact: Arlo Prins, Lead Control Partner via arlo.prins@rabobank.nl.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Jackelien Roelofs, IT recruiter via jackelien.roelofs@rabobank.nl
We will hold the interviews through a video call.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Are you a Scrum Master who is passionate about Agile and committed to driving team excellence? Rabobank has a fantastic opportunity for you. Take on the exciting challenge of elevating our agile teams and development processes to new heights.
You and your job
As Scrum Master, you will work closely with two squads to facilitate Scrum ceremonies, coach and mentor on Agile practices, and remove any impediments that hinder the squads' progress. You will also ensure effective communication, continuous improvement, and facilitate team motivation and empowerment. As Scrum Master, you will be an integral part of our Operational Risk Platforms Area, which plays a crucial role in supporting Rabobank to manage Operational Risk, Compliance, Legal, and Audit. You will support the Area in growing its maturity by participating in and supporting various Area rituals, and working closely with the Area leadership.
Practical Examples
You will facilitate Squad and Area Scrum rituals, including planning, stand-up, reviews and retrospectives.
You will support the Product Owners in maintaining healthy product backlogs. Together with the product owners and the DevOps teams you will work on planning and roadmap of activities
You will facilitate cross-team alignment to work towards successful delivery of products.
You will support the Area Leadership team on Area transformation topics. These topics might be outside the squads you are assigned to as Scrum Master allowing you to operate on a bigger scale.
Facts & Figures
36- to 40-hours per week
43,822 Rabobank colleagues around the world
Together we achieve more than alone
We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team at the Area Operational Risk Platforms. Working together is the way we work; as 1 results-driven team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.
You and your talent
You have completed a Bachelor’s degree or Master’s degree
You have at least 5 years of experience as a Scrum Master and/or Agile Coach
You have at least an advanced Scrum Master certificate like PSM2 (Scrum.org) or you are an Advanced Certified ScrumMaster (ScrumAlliance.org)
Experience with the Spotify Scrum at Scale model is a plus
You have the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
You have strong problem-solving skills and ability to identify and remove impediments
You have excellent communication, leadership and interpersonal skills
You have experience with coaching multi-cultural teams
You master the English language. It is a pre if you are fluent in Dutch
This is what we offer you
up to € 5,655 gross per month (scale 9)
thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
an extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out
a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-
a personal development budget of € 1,400-
a combination of working from home and at the office
100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport
a pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5% or 5.5% (based on your own preference)
151.2 hours holiday per year including 1 Diversity Day per year
This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Scrum Master based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.
You and the job application process
Responses will be handled in accordance with vacancy management.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact: Angèl Wijnhard, Recruiter via Angel.Wijnhard@rabobank.nl.
We will hold the interviews through a video call and in person.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

Internship Business & Client Operations Analyst
At a glance

During your internship at ABN AMRO it is necessary that you are enrolled at a Dutch education institution.
Are you a last year HBO or WO student with a knack for Data Analytics, Business and Client contact? Are you looking for a place in which you can develop yourself? Search no more! ABN AMRO Clearing offers you the possibility to work with the best professionals in the business. We are looking for you!
Your job

For this assignment you’ll join the Client Operations’ team of ABN AMRO Clearing Bank. Our goal is to help our clients to make their business easy, reliable and secure. To fulfil this objective whilst the world around us is constantly changing, we must keep a continuous eye on automation and innovation.
As a part of the team, you can participate in improvement projects by providing a different and fresh perspective on our processes.
Your activities will include:
Supporting the process improvement.
Supporting the team in day-to-day client business by handling client queries, having client calls and offering the clients the best services possible.
Helping with the implementation of long term client improvements.
Creating a plan of approach and conducting research & data analysis.
Your working environment

The Clearing Client Operations consists of around 30 people. We are responsible for the communication with clients in regard to operational services. We strive to achieve the highest quality of service by maintaining continuous feedback loop with the client. The goal of Clearing Operations is to make client’s business easy, reliable and secure. We achieve this by helping clients on their day to day issues, while making long term improvements with the clients’ input. By working together we are responsible for processing approximately 15 million transactions on average per day.
Our working environment is international, diverse and dynamic. Our employees vary from fresh graduates to senior professionals in the business. The official language is English. We are looking for someone who is communicative and client focused, and can find areas of improvement in our operations. The most important thing is that you have a passion for your work and would like to learn and grow within our organisation.
Your profile
You are a Bachelor / Master student (HBO or WO); Masters Preferred.
You have an affinity with financial markets/ interest in banking.
You are available full time (36-40 hours), preferably for 9 months, and are enrolled in a Dutch university.
Team Player: You are a social person who loves to work in groups and likes to share responsibilities, successes and laughs.
Communicative & Client Oriented: You enjoy meeting & connecting with people
Analytical & Problem Solver: Your advanced analytical skills and creativity enables you to deconstruct complex problems & come up with strategic solutions
Preferable experience in technologies like Python, Tableau, SQL, etc. But not required when you have other good qualities to offer!
What we offer

You will have the chance to work in one of the best work environments in The Netherlands. You’ll be offered a personal development coach that will enable you to make the most of this opportunity. At AACB we encourage you to develop yourself constantly! You will be working with the best professionals in the business and with the latest technologies, in a creative, flexible and easy going atmosphere. We offer you the possibility to stand out and make a difference. The world of banking is changing rapidly, and AACB is changing with it. Therefore, we invest in Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, Big Data Analytics, Robotics, apps & APIs, IT security, new business models and much more. Banking is not only about storing and transferring your money anymore, we go beyond banking!
Interested?

If you are confident about becoming a valuable member of our team, apply right away!
How to do it?
Put only job relevant items in your CV and letter.
In your letter present yourself briefly and then tell us WHY you are interested in both this assignment in particular and working at ABN AMRO Clearing in general. Subsequently, explain HOW you will be adding value to our team by highlighting your relevant skills and experience.
Lastly, always include your availability period (e.g February 2023 - August 2023).
We are looking forward to get to know you!
Any doubts, questions or compliments for us? Get in touch via email (it.stages@nl.abnamro.com)
Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

If you are a commercial, competitive and creative sales coach with a passion for winning and leading high performing teams – this could be the role for you. We are looking for Pursuit Leaders to join our Deal Activation Team in The Netherlands. We are a team of sales and tender specialists deployed to support our most strategic and high value pursuits focused on listed companies and Private Interest Entities (PIEs).

The opportunity
The Pursuit Leader is responsible for the Business Development aspects of the firms’ most important pursuits, taking the leadership role in developing the winning pitch strategy, coaching the client team and managing the BD support team.

Your Key Responsibilities
Managing the BD support team and taking responsibility for all aspects of sales support provided during a pursuit, including the client team members involved, the Pursuit Strategist and Creative Designer to ensure all deadlines are met and the BD contribution is properly understood and measured.
Leading the development of the pursuit strategy by ensuring the client team fully understand the client needs and can clearly articulate the benefits of the EY solution and our value proposition. Conducting one-to-one and team coaching sessions to ensure the team fully understand these client needs, the EY solution and can clearly articulate their role, experience and credentials in a convincing, winning manner. Taking an active role in managing and challenging the client team dynamics to ensure the ‘A’ team is properly presented to the client including personal style, subject matter expertise and credentials.
Devising the relationship development action plan to ensure appropriate contact is made with all decision makers and influencers using the whole EY network.
Contributing to the engagement economics discussion to ensure the appropriate pricing options are challenged and positively articulated providing a return for the firm and value for the client.
Supporting client interviews to ensure the team fully understands the needs and decision making criteria of the client, the EY solution and why we won or lost a pursuit.
Skills And Attributes For Success
Deep understanding and experience of pursuits and winning sales strategies.
An excellent command of both the Dutch and English languages.
At least 6 years of relevant working experience.
People-management/leadership of large teams in complex, cross border, high value sales.
Coaching upwards of more senior people and history of achieving results through others.
Major account management experience including responsibility for client relationships, service levels, solution development and revenue targets.
Commercially astute, able to operate at board level.
To qualify for the role you must have
People management experience.
Client service and sales experience.
Strong facilitation, training and presentation skills.
Excellent communication skills – verbal, written and visual.
Exceptional stakeholder management skills.
Ideally, you’ll also have
A passion for getting the best out of people.
An innovation mind-set.
Team player mentality.
Determination to win in the market.
What We Look For
Commercial, creative and competitive sales coaches who are passionate about winning, and developing and leading high performing teams.

What We Offer
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible: Afra Verpaalen, Corporate Recruiter (06 5544 2185).
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
Find out more on www.werkenbijey.nl about the many benefits to which you are entitled as employee at EY.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.
An (online) assessment and a pre employment screening are part of the application procedure.

job_titles: Meta Data & Data Modelling Analyst (Level V)
job_description:
Wholesale Banking Data Management
Wholesale Banking Data Management is responsible for designing, driving, and implementing a strategy, model and platform to ensure effective data management. It is structured around primary and foundational capabilities. These capabilities ensure governance implementation, definitions, policies and processes, quality, organizational structure, data architecture & delivery, ING Esperanto, protection of personal data, security, and sustained awareness addressing the stakeholders' requirements and targets. All of this aligned with our purpose:
‘To embed Data Management in the core of ING, unleash it’s potential ad make data matter’.
Your role and working environment
The CoE Definitions, Quality and Metadata is all about making sure our datasets are defined and described in business recognized terms in such a way to ensure adequate reporting of data, optimize reuse and availability through the use of catalogues, descriptions and making sure the data can be found. You will be working out of the CoE as an analyst on content related topic in the teams in the Data Delivery team. Creating local data definitions, participating in Esperanto co-creation for global data definitions, mapping local Sources of Record into Esperanto and the EWM and in general overall support during team delivery will be your main responsibilities.
All analysts are developing craftsmanship in the CoE chapter and in such a way ensure harmonisation of data for our consumers. Next to that, you will be working to implement the meta-data management strategies defined by the CoE and CDMO. You will be in the functional heart of ING’s data strategy, cooperating with global teams across the various HUBs.
Your key responsibilities
 As a Meta Data & Data Modelling Analyst you will:
Collaborate with Business Data Owners, Data Stewards, and Stakeholders to examine and understand their data points
Collaborate with Data Consumers to understand their requirements and make sure they are expressed in ING’s global data language
Be responsible for content analysis of local sources, local data definitions, mappings into global Esperanto business terms, defining testing scenarios and be part of the CoE Data Delivery teams
Be part of the CoE chapter to develop your capabilities and competencies as well as improving your CDMO Esperanto knowledge
Support defining requirements for Data Quality, Data Lineage, Reference Data, and Data Governance
Support, coach and train colleagues on adopting and implementing our models
Report on the progress and communicate the dependencies and impediments to stakeholders
Contribute to existing principles, standards, guidelines and way of working to continuously improve them
Make sure Sources of Record are mapped into Esperanto in a harmonized way
Participate in strategic meta data & modelling initiatives
Build a culture of meta data & modelling craftmanship and improvement
Drive synergies across the global Data management community and stimulate collaboration to ensure delivery on commitments, without relying on hierarchical structure or formal committees to do so.
Your key competences
You are an Orange Code ambassador with data modelling and mapping skills
You are technically capable to work with the various data management tools like Information Governance Catalogue, Information Data Architect, SQL, ORACLE and are not afraid to get into the detail of the data that you are working with
 You are able to align across the various global locations with your colleagues in order to ensure harmonization of data mappings into the Esperanto EWM
You are consistent and structured in your way of working, you understand the importance of meta-data, you will acknowledge the importance of the various governance aspects and are willing to keep them part of your integral day to day work
You have excellent analytical skills and know how to convince your peers in case of disputes
You are able to handle multiple projects at the same time involving different stakeholders and focus on achieving results
You are a naturally collaborative person, who listens and invests in others to achieve common goals and at the same time pushes, where needed, to break through existing routines
You have a critical mind-set with respect to what is requested and delivered.
You are a hands-on type of person and have a structured way of working
You are a good communicator, fluent in English (written and spoken) with strong stakeholder management skills
You take responsibility to get the work done
You actively ask for help and feedback and are not afraid to give feedback
You easily adapt to a new environment
Your previous experience and skillset
You have 10 years of experience in analysis or data modelling and/or mapping domain
 You have a proven track-record in complicated analytical and technical landscapes
 You are willing to work with global teams across the world, and are therefore fluent in English
You actively keep up your professional knowledge and translate external trends into applicable knowledge
Proven banking & product knowledge. Finance and/or Risk experience enabling understanding of banking products and their attributes (Nice to have)
You have experience in guiding and realizing regulatory/processes changes and translating regulatory requirements into functional designs and/or processes
You have strong communication, presentation, networking and influencing skills
Design Thinking, which enables big-picture view but also the attention to details required for in-depth analyses
What we offer
A job from 36 to 40 hours and a unique offer that fits in with the times of today. We take into account your home situation and your ambitions and help you to balance work and private life. Discover yourself our employment conditions.;
A salary tailored to your qualities and experience;
Flexible working hours and the possibility to work at home;
Reimbursement for travel expenses;
24 vacation days with a 36-hour working week. If you work 40 hours a week, you will receive 27 vacation days;
Pension scheme;
13th month salary;
Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary;
8% Holiday payment;
Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities to realize your ambitions;
An informal working environment with innovative colleagues who strive for the very best.
Questions?
Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.
Please note, multiple interview steps involving various business stakeholders will be part of the selection process.

job_titles: Front End Chapter Lead Personal Banking
job_description:
Front End Chapter Lead Personal Banking
At a glance

Are you a technical expert and a people person who likes to work in a team but also wants to coach and inspire others? Then we are looking for you as Frontend Chapter Lead at our Consumer Grid.

Within the Consumer Grid we work every day hard to develop and run the ABN AMRO App, Grip App and ABN AMRO Internet Banking. We strongly believe in Design Thinking and a DevOps way of working. This helps us to research the real problems of our customers and come up with the right solutions for them.
Your job

Within the Personal Banking Grid at ABN AMRO, we are building mobile & web applications. We offer a great digital experience for our clients to engage with their financial needs in a personal way. Examples are the Grip app, the ABN AMRO App and the ABN AMRO Internet Banking website.
At the Personal Banking Grid we believe in an agile way of working, while focusing on solid principles that gives teams a sense of autonomy and purpose in their job. Next to that we give everyone the opportunity to get better and grow in their skills.
We love to share knowledge and to challenge each other, for example by sharing our expertise in our blog, during the events of our developer community and by organizing hackathons.

We offer flexibility to decide when and where you work and what is most comfortable and effective. Of course, we offer you the right resources you need to set up a good home office. For example, an ergonomic chair, desk and laptop.
Working environment

As Frontend Chapter Lead, you will combine working as an Frontend engineer, with your role as Lead. This includes:
Coaching your Chapter members on technical craftsmanship
Guiding personal development of the people in your team
Take care of the HR processes to facilitate all aspects relating to recruitment and the on- and offboarding of employees, development and performance
Alignment with other chapters so we learn from each other and create strong a strong community of developers. Together you create a vision and strategy
Actively participating in knowledge gaining and sharing by hosting triangles, circles, communities and events
Alignment with IT Lead and Scrum Master
Create and foster a healthy working environment and a holistic culture for your Chapter
Educating yourself and others with the right technical capabilities and the latest innovations
Your profile
5+ years of experience in Vue.js
Advanced with CI/CD tooling like Jenkins
Programming languages
Strong problem-solving skills
Coaching skills
Understand and act upon the Scrum Values (openness, courage, commitment, respect and focus)
Strong communication skills in English
Experience in working DevOps
Release management
We are offering

As a Front End Chapter Lead you are given every opportunity and independence to demonstrate your professional expertise in a no-nonsense environment and to further develop yourself. We attach great value to personal development and thereby offer you many training and development opportunities. In addition:
The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
Market conform salary
Pension scheme
Benefit budget, so you can decide yourself if you want extra holiday allowances, a lease bike or that you want the budget paid out
Personal development budget
Banking for better days. These are days you can use for your personal development or on which you can contribute to society
Interested?

Are you interested? Then respond to this vacancy! Although we appreciate you writing an motivational letter, this is not mandatory for your application. When you don't have a motivation letter please upload a double cv or a blanco document.
For more information, you can reach out to Pleun Stokkers (pleun.stokkers@nl.abnamro.com). We would like to get to know you!
Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.
Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

Background
The Global CISO organisation within ING is responsible for assisting management, business and other tribes in providing customer-friendly services safely and securely. Business leaders and CISO are jointly responsible for bank-wide security, and CISO is mandated to drive necessary change in all domains, business and IT.
Given the current team composition, we would like to expand the team with someone who has subject expertise on security topics like vulnerability management or identity and access management. With this (and some coding experience) as a foundation, you can enhance your skillset with data science techniques.
The Security Data Scientist is working in the Center of Expertise Security Strategy and Data to identify, design and implement data solutions based on advanced AI and machine learning techniques within the CISO function. This is concerning one or more of the areas of Security Detection and Response (SDR), Identity and Access Management (IAM) and Attack Surface Management (ASM). This role is pivotal in executing and heightening the CISO strategy to make the security capabilities more data driven.
The Security Data Scientist reports to the Expert Lead Security Data Analytics for day-to-day activities and maintains a functional relationship to the head of the aforementioned areas of specialisation.
 The Security Data Scientist helps to assess the quality of the current solutions such as security detection and provides technical/strategical expertise on several areas of improvement. Notably, he or she will co-create end-to-end analytical models and put those into a production environment.
The role will be medior from 4 years of experience and senior from 10 years of experience.
Key Responsibilities
A Security Data Scientist at ING CISO combines subject matter expertise on the CISO capability areas (SDR, IAM, ASM) with expertise on data analytics and is responsible for:
Driving the development and implementation of sustainable and maintainable data solutions, including analytical models in the CISO areas
Data exploration, organisation, model production, and adoption within CISO and beyond
has subject expertise on security topics like vulnerability management or identity and access management
Identifying functional and non-functional requirements from stakeholders aimed at providing high-quality data solutions for ING.
Acting as a point of contact for new data products
Supervising, from a technical perspective, more junior members of the team
Maintaining relations with the country and business unit leaders, as well as our internal stakeholders, to ensure the effectiveness and usability of the data products created
Acting as overall AI expert also towards our stakeholders
Support and coach the data analytics teams in the CISO areas ASM, SDR and IAM
Requirements
Proven track record and technical skills:
A Technical Master’s degree (e.g. cybersecurity, computer sciences, Mathematics or a comparable degree)
This function is a medior/senior function with 4-10 years of working experience (and relevant security experience)
Experience in larger companies and corporate consulting are a plus.
Subject matter expert in analytics, machine learning, and quantitative (data) modelling.
Experienced in the following programming languages, tools and platforms:
Python (and basic ML libraries, e.g. Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib)
Pyspark and Spark streaming
Git
Azure and Google cloud AI platforms
Databricks
Workflows (jobs and delta live tables)
Good understanding of security data analytics
Proven experience in developing and delivering end-to-end security solutions using analytics
Good oral and written communication skills, as well as good negotiation skills
Can demonstrate success in establishing relationships and influencing decision-making
Ability to simplify complexity and drive operational excellence
Ability to support yourself and help develop other team members
Excellent level of English
Experience in a financial environment is a plus

Expert (application) security specialist
At a glance

Digital bank robbers are getting smarter and smarter. Can you keep our data behind bars?
The need for information security is growing in a fast pace, especially within the banking sector, where there is much to be gained for cyber attackers. For this reason we are constantly looking for smarter ways to make digital banking as safe as possible. This is a key capability because there is a lot at stake.
The IT security wizards within our organization are the expert IT security advisors and monitors. As a wizard you help our colleagues designing and running secure applications in a DevOps environment.
Do you understand application security, are you able to provide expert advice, are you a good communicator that can bridge gaps and work in a team? Then we want you to join our team! We can provide you with excellent opportunities to further develop yourself, in a sector that is part of critical infrastructure, and as part of a larger team of great professionals to spar with.
Your job

You play a crucial role in securing our application landscape. You focus on our crown jewels, and ensure that security is constantly improving, amidst IT transformation such as our journey to the cloud, the implementation of DevOps and an Agile way of working. You contribute to the safety of the bank by securing individual applications, but also by looking at the bigger picture. You brainstorm, advise and work together with our talented development teams to ensure information security at the start of our banking products. Briefly: a constant co-creation and security by design!
ABN AMRO’s IT organization is your biggest client, which is an international environment with people from all over the world. You meet with your colleagues frequently, and sit in with start-ups. It is important to scale the business and customer interests against possible risks. If information security is at stake, you will have to step in and quickly come up with creative and smart alternatives. There is a range of technologies and external parties you will work with. Including the major cloud providers. This job provides you with the opportunity to work in a large diversity of tech, tech organizations, and colleagues.
Working environment

You will become part of CISO Technology and Engineering (T&E), which is part of Corporate Information Security Office (CISO). The CISO department consists of approx. 500 employees and works on the entire information security of the bank. T&E is a multinational team with over 90 employees. We focus on IT security and people security, and work with our IT-colleagues to ensure appropriate infrastructure and application security. In terms of hierarchy, there is little to be noticed as we work together in completing our tasks.
Working at ABN AMRO means: getting even better in what you do. We understand customers, translate their ambitions into common success and earn trust. We want our customers to understand our products. This means that we sometimes turn customers away if the risk of a product is great for them. Customer interest is also: providing a clear product range and communicating clearly. Banking is our profession, the world is our challenge. Moreover, we are socially involved and committed to the ABN AMRO Foundation. For instance, we contribute to giving Christmas presents to the less fortunate and we engage in charity walk.
Your profile

You are an expert (application) security specialist who is able to maintain a clear overview, can lead groups on content, and can present and communicate to management and larger groups of colleagues. You are leading on content and contribution, and set the bar for application security. You are leading towards your team mates and coach them to learn. You create an overview across our estate.
You have extensive experience with all aspects of application security, and have supported application migration, transition and re-platforming before. You understand the balance between technical security measures and potential organizational mitigating measures. You identify application security themes across our estate and push for continuous improvement. You perform well under pressure.
You are able to entice colleagues with your ideas. This means you can easily convince people and transpose technical jargons into understandable language effortlessly. Sometimes you will only be given five minutes to substantiate your advice and solution. This should be enough to make your statement.
Please check your profile if you believe to be a good fit in the team:
10+ years of experience in the IT security / application security field
A degree in Information Science or relevant studies
Information Security (IS) professional qualifications such as CISSP, CCSP, CEH, CISA, CISM and CCSK
Broad knowledge of different IT and security capabilities and processes
Development life-cycle knowledge, e.g. secure SDLC and security by design
Experience with performing security assessments and with translating generic security requirements to specific cases
Cloud security with special focus on the Azure public cloud
Experience with IS documentation, -report writing, reviewing and consulting
Stakeholder management skills, especially in a multi-cultural and international environment
Core competencies in leading on content and within team, whilst being a team player
Strong communication skills both verbally and in writing in English, Dutch being a big plus
We are offering

The chance to become even better as a security professional, by working in a critical sector and in a large team of likeminded professionals. Does IT security make your heart skip a beat? Then this role is for you! Our office in Amsterdam Southeast is your home base. We are also flexible, and working part of the week from home is the norm. ABN AMRO gives great importance to personal development and therefore offers a lot of training and career opportunities. In addition, you will receive a competitive salary (in Hay 12) and an attractive package of employee benefits. With this, you can determine your own conditions for a large part.
Interested?

Respond to this online vacancy if interested. For more information please contact Rob Havermans, Head of CISO Technology & Engineering (rob.havermans@nl.abnamro.com). We would like to meet you!

The Job
Building a secure network is your hobby, but you can switch easily in a mindset to an enterprise environment where uptime, performance, and security are critical to serving our customers optimally. You like to script and program for fun but can apply these skills to your job as well. You are an energetic engineer who is creative and has a can-do mentality. You are a team player, collaboration and sharing knowledge is a natural behavior.
Based in the Netherlands, you will join an international team that works towards the target infra architecture for DDoS Protection on the Global and Regional Datacenter that consists of on-premise and cloud-based solutions.

Together we build on existing and new technologies to mitigate attacks and increase security and availability for ING’s public assets. You will participate in agile work processes such as daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and planning. Together with the Product Owner, the team (Squad) works on common goals and a shared backlog. We use video and collaboration tools to facilitate the communication process.
What you do (Capabilities)

You deliver standard, self-service infrastructure services to the Global IT consumers together with your squad. You can move all typical user stories and tasks from “To-Do” to “Done.”
This primary focus is on the on-premises and cloud-based DDoS protection in Europe and Asia.
You are primarily end-to-end responsible for Global DDoS protection. This includes monitoring, incident and change management of on-premises appliances, cloud-based scrubbing services.
Your role also includes:
Improvement of monitoring and alerting of these services (incorporate into tools for whole DDoS squad)
Consultancy for internet network implementations
Keep DDoS squad members up-to-date on local developments, improvements, and alerts
Build local contacts with CCERT (SDC) for DDoS attack mitigation and follow-up
Participate in DDoS incidents, changes, and improvements for the Global Datacenters
You recognize yourself in this profile (Competencies)

With your expertise in Anti-DDoS concepts, secure infrastructures, event monitoring and automation via scripting, you contribute to the squad’s mission of delivering top-notch Anti-DDoS protection for our global services.
Competencies – Skills
Experienced IP engineer with an angle into network security
Experience with Anti-DDoS implementations
Experience with Web Application Firewall solutions is an added value
Experience programming in one or more of the following languages: C/C++, Python, JavaScript or Java
Knowledge of configuration tools like Puppet, Chef or Ansible
The technology of interfacing squads and consumers to achieve an end-to-end view
Impact of different factors on the performance and capacity of services different elements on the performance and capacity of services
Working-level knowledge of Agile and DevOps practices
Understanding of the Scrum methodology (e.g., backlog and spring planning, review and marketplace)
Knowledge of DevOps way of working (e.g., continuous delivery, cross-functional team set-ups, development of cross-skilled squad members)
Competencies - Behaviours
The mindset of openness and willingness to try new ways of working and technologies
End-to-end ownership mindset
Active team player who takes responsibility
Independent and autonomous in completing tasks
The mentality of continuous improvement of the service and way of working
Reflects upon behaviors and performance to proactively identify improvement areas
Strong problem solver to structure and improve complex situations
Coaches others to help their individual development
Your education and background
Professional and intellectual IT ability at least a bachelor’s degree
Certifications or proven proficiency in Networking and Security
Certifications or proven proficiency in one or more programming/scripting languages
Excellent command of spoken and written English
Rewards & benefits
We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

About us
With 57,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING. Join us. Apply today.
